elements.title: inauguration of Lai Ching-te (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that China launched a military exercise in response to the inauguration of Lai Ching-te as president of Taiwan (pictured)?

elements.title: Luxembourg has won the Eurovision Song Contest five times (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although Luxembourg has won the Eurovision Song Contest five times, none of the winning artists representing the country have been native Luxembourgers?

elements.title: Dylan Travis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that basketball player Dylan Travis played for nine head coaches in nine years?

elements.title: The Chinese in America (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Chinese in America documents how people in California, during the gold rush era, mailed their laundry to Hong Kong for cleaning?

elements.title: a member (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a member of the House of Lords was the principal of a Canadian junior school?

elements.title: Frutiger Aero (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite being invented in the 2000s, Frutiger Aero was not named until 2017?

elements.title: Roscoe "Red" Jackson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Roscoe "Red" Jackson was the last person to be publicly executed in the United States?

elements.title: 2024 U.S. Olympic basketball team (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Cameroonian-born Joel Embiid opted to play for the 2024 U.S. Olympic basketball team instead of France in part because his son is American?

elements.title: Wong Sau Ying (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after Wong Sau Ying attempted to assassinate a British colonial official, the police and press began to associate the bob cut with anarchism?
